definition: (onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words

sentences.english: At the end of the son’s reply the father was speechless.
sentences.chinese: 聽完兒子的話，父親啞口無言。
其實我當時我就啞口了。

sentences.english: The blessing of the Lord is upon the head of the just: but iniquity covereth the mouth of the wicked.
sentences.chinese: 上主的祝福在義人頭上，災禍卻使惡人啞口無言。

sentences.english: I couldn't understand why Mana Ina would not answer my parents when they asked her questions.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道爲什麼父母問曼娜艾娜問題時她卻啞口無言。

sentences.english: She extinguished him with a single word.
sentences.chinese: 她一句話就說得他啞口無言。

sentences.english: A series of ironclad facts put him to silence.
sentences.chinese: 一系列鐵的事實駁得他啞口無言。

sentences.english: If he doesn't call, he's probably still tongue-tied from being in your presence.
sentences.chinese: 如果他不請，他大概仍啞口無言被你的存在。

sentences.english: Robert was shocked almost to dumbness.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯特被驚得啞口無言。

sentences.english: He tried to speak but he was still mute.
sentences.chinese: 他盡力想說，卻仍然啞口無聲。

sentences.english: They were talking and laughing away but they stopped as soon as a visitor appeared.
sentences.chinese: 她們正說笑得起勁，見來了客人，便立即啞口了。

sentences.english: She squelched them with biting sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 她用尖刻的挖苦話使人啞口無言。

sentences.english: Louis and I were speechless, paralyzed.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯和我都啞口無言，呆住了。

sentences.english: And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground, and I became dumb.
sentences.chinese: 他向我這樣說，我就臉面朝地，啞口無聲。

sentences.english: We gaze at each other as dumb animals gaze at human beings.
sentences.chinese: 我們啞口無言，像愚笨的動物癡望人類一樣面面相覷。

sentences.english: Of being an adult and having no voice?
sentences.chinese: 做爲一個成年人，卻這樣啞口無聲？

sentences.english: And dumb, let's have some more dumb.
sentences.chinese: 又啞巴，讓我們有更多的啞口無聲。

definition: lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to return something to its rightful owner
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
